item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The Wanderer:

I actually believe this won’t be able to be combated by the bot makers. My hypothesis of what they are doing is some serious data analysis by first comparing how a bot plays rs and then how a real rs player plays rs. All of the data being sent would be through the packets, so its not like the client changed anything. thats what it sounded like to me, kinda how they could notice where all of the money went from that serious dupe, I believe they have some serious data analysis going on :p.

And the challenge becomes designing this automatons to act more human-like. I don’t think bot makers have really made a genuine attempt at that. Returning a randomized interval of time to sleep before continuing to the next state of the current bot script isn’t even close to emulating human activity. Bots could do way better.

Not that I want them to, of course.

Read full topic

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=562020.msg4099145#msg4099145 date=1347229402]

Mhm. And this helps build the negative outlook on botting within the community. A new player seeing a bot being humiliated and blown up into flames will be discouraged from botting in the future.

I would stand in the Grand Exchange and perform repetitive actions just to see it first person
[/quote]They have specifically said that normal people skilling wont be affected, they seem very confident in whatever they have developed…

What about if said normal person went three days without sleep?
[/quote]I doubt that’s how it works, considering they know people no-life[/quote]
It would be interesting to know how it works.
